intro: Hibiscus convolvulaceus, commonly known as the coral vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The flowers are typically 5 to 7 inches long and bloom throughout the growing season. The plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Its rapid growth habit makes it suitable for covering trellises, fences, or as a ground cover in warm climates.
